Posts.Content: Marie261973 wrote: hi everyone I am new here and have been a little confused.In November I had my first mammogram because I was approaching my 41st birthday. They saw a solid mass in my left breast and I had to go for a diagnostic mammogram and ultrasound.They saw the same thing.I went to see a doctor at the breast center and she said she would like to do a core biopsy. I had that done and then waited for the results.When I met with the nurse practitioner  she told me it was benign.I was so excited .She checked me with an ultrasound and said....wait a minute.Apparently there was a spot near the clip that didn't look touched?she also said she was concerned about the vagueness of the pathology report.All it said was benign breast tissue.She told me that I was def. going to need to come back in3 months.Just the other day she called me and said that the surgeon wants to either do an excision  Biopsy or another core biopsy.I am leaning towards the excisional. Has anyone had a similar experience to this?thanks:) Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Confused about needing a repeat biopsy Marie261973 Petitegal127

Posts.Content: Mar 29, 2014 11:25PM - edited Mar 30, 2014 09:42AM by Marie261973 I went back to get checked and the surgeon said that the pathology is discordant with what she sees.The surgeon showed me the ultrasound of the needle going through the center of the tumor during the core biopsy .So she knows she was in the right area. The pathologist had just written "benign breast tissue" on the report from the last core and the surgeon said "she knows that is not healthy tissue."So to put this all to rest I have opted for an excisional biopsy. Hopefully I will be in that 80 percent that are benign.
Posts.Title: Confused about needing a repeat biopsy Marie261973 Petitegal127

Posts.Content: Apr 19, 2014 06:12AM Marie261973 wrote: Hi  Petitegal, great news  I had my excisional biopsy and it ended up being a Fibroadenoma. I was nervous before the surgery but the hospital was great! My surgeon first wanted to see me in six months but then said we could actually wait for one year. :)thank you for the moral support!
Posts.Title: Confused about needing a repeat biopsy Marie261973 Petitegal127

Posts.Content: Feb 25, 2014 10:01PM Marie261973 wrote: Thank you Melissa.That sounds exactly like what is going on and I thank you for the explanation.I was feeling overwhelmed when I spoke with the N.P. and I was not processing what she was saying. But as I read your post I remembered she also mentioned that they saw some hardening of the breast tissue and that was not mentioned by the pathologist.We will see what happens.My follow up appt. is 3/28 and we are supposed to discuss all this then. I hate the waiting and appreciate your support.
Posts.Title: Confused about needing a repeat biopsy Marie261973 Petitegal127

Posts.Content: Feb 25, 2014 10:05PM - edited Feb 25, 2014 10:09PM by Marie261973 Thank you for all of your support and advice.I think they are being thorough too.It's nice to know I'm not alone with this.I hope you are all doing well.It feels good to have some support! This is all new to me.My mother has breast cancer(she had a lumpectomy)so I think that adds to my wandering thoughts.

Posts.Content: Apr 9, 2014 01:34PM Marie261973 wrote: well I had an excisional biopsy yesterday.The surgery took about an hour.The incision is about 2.5 inches and does not hurt.She used inner stitches and then skin glue to close it. No other dressing was needed. My surgeon told me that to her naked eye it looks like a Fibroadenoma but we will need to look at it under the microscope to confirm that.So I will eagerly be waiting for a benign result. I am 98percent relieved :)
Posts.Title: Confused about needing a repeat biopsy Marie261973 Petitegal127

Posts.Content: Apr 10, 2014 10:41AM Marie261973 wrote: I am so glad to hear that they got your pre-cancerous cells out.Thank goodness.I am also thrilled for the benign result for you. Thank you for the support.It helps to talk to someone in a similar situation.I am eagerly waiting to hear good news officially.Fingers crossed:)
